posts.name: Tophermartini
posts.cooked:
Thanks to all that helped resolve the software update issue last night!

When setting up my DGX Spark it was easy to get Tailscale installed and running so that it can be added to my development environment. A Mac running macOS 26.0.1 is where NVIDIA Sync is running.

Using NVIDIA Sync I’m able to add and connect to the Spark with everything except the Tailnet DNS hostname.

  • Local IP
    • PASS add device
    • PASS connect to device
  • Local mDNS
    • PASS add device
    • PASS connect to device
  • Tailscale IP
    • PASS add device
    • PASS connect to device
  • Tailnet DNS
    • PASS add device
    • FAIL connect to device

The .err file is empty, below is from the .out file:

{
 "heading": "Unexpected Error",
 "details": "listen unix /Users/tophermartini/Library/Application Support/NVIDIA/Sync/session/topher-spark.tailXXXX.ts.net.socket: bind: invalid argument"
}

At first I thought it was a Tailscale routing issue, but the Tailscale IP works no problem. Is there something specific about the Tailnet DNS that would cause an issue within NVIDIA Sync?

posts.name: Braden Keith
posts.cooked: I can confirm I’m also experiencing this issue. Tailscale IP works fine, but the DNS fails to connect from Nvidia Sync, even though its passing the add device dialog. SSH at the same DNS works fine.

I am on macOS: 26.0.1 on WiFI (isolated SSID; NAT IP / L2 disabled); not able to ping Spark.
Tailscale: 1.88.4
Spark: latest updates applied via DGX Dashboard
Spark on Ethernet (RJ45)
NVIDIA Sync: 0.41.22

With the Spark and Mac connected to Tailscale I was able to connect NVIDIA Sync to the Tailscale IP and Tailnet DNS (magicDNS).
I have two devices setup in NVIDIA Sync (TailScale IP / Tailnet DNS) and connect/disconnect to test both.
I am able to open the DGX Dashboard from both connections.

I went to grab my tailnetDNS settings but Tailscale has an outage and the admin console is down.

For mDNS - assume spark-xxxx.local?

posts.name: Tophermartini
posts.cooked:
Thanks for the information!

Looking at the logs for NVIDIA Sync it appears to be using the CLI inside the app bundle. When running the sequence of commands manually it shows the Tailnet DNS (magicDNS) is completing the create command but failing on the connect command;

Tailscale IP connection:

$ ./nvsync-arm64 create ssh://tophermartini@100.93.35.XX                  
Password: 
 $ ./nvsync-arm64 connect 100.93.35.XX --detach 
 $ ./nvsync-arm64 disconnect 100.93.35.XX
 $ ./nvsync-arm64 delete 100.93.35.XX

Tailnet DNS connection:

 $ ./nvsync-arm64 create ssh://tophermartini@topher-spark.tailXXXXXX.ts.net
Password: 
 $ ./nvsync-arm64 connect topher-spark.tailXXXXXX.ts.net --detach
{
 "heading": "Unexpected Error",
 "details": "daemon not running: socket /Users/tophermartini/Library/Application Support/NVIDIA/Sync/session/topher-spark.tailXXXXXX.ts.net.socket doesn't exist"
}
 $ ./nvsync-arm64 delete topher-spark.tailXXXXXX.ts.net

Using the Tailscale IP the connect command returns almost immediately.

With the Tailnet DNS the command appears to hit a timeout before returning. Running with the debug and verbose flags confirm the timeout;

./nvsync-arm64 connect topher-spark.tailXXXXXX.ts.net --detach --debug --verbose
9:03PM DBG nvsync command args=["./nvsync-arm64","connect","topher-spark.tailXXXXXX.ts.net","--detach","--debug","--verbose"] pid=8478
9:03PM DBG checking for daemon to be running hostname=topher-spark.tailXXXXXX.ts.net pid=8478
9:03PM DBG waiting for socket file to be created hostname=topher-spark.tailXXXXXX.ts.net i=0 pid=8478
9:03PM DBG waiting for socket file to be created hostname=topher-spark.tailXXXXXX.ts.net i=1 pid=8478
...
9:04PM DBG waiting for socket file to be created hostname=topher-spark.tailXXXXXX.ts.net i=29 pid=8478
9:04PM ERR daemon not running: socket doesn't exist pid=8478 socket="/Users/tophermartini/Library/Application Support/NVIDIA/Sync/session/topher-spark.tailXXXXXX.ts.net.socket"
{
 "heading": "Unexpected Error",
 "details": "daemon not running: socket /Users/tophermartini/Library/Application Support/NVIDIA/Sync/session/topher-spark.tailXXXXXX.ts.net.socket doesn't exist"
}

Is there anything about how Tailnet DNS (magicDNS) is configured on the Spark that would prevent the socket from opening successfully?

Beginning to wonder if the Spark can see itself via the Tailnet DNS… all attempts to resolve the Tailnet DNS from a remote computer seem to be working.

posts.name: Tophermartini
posts.cooked:
After going way to deep down this tailscale rabbit hole, it looks like a known issue on multiple platforms;

$ tailscale status

# Health check:
#     - Tailscale can't reach the configured DNS servers. Internet connectivity may be affected.
github.com/tailscale/tailscale

DNS issue

opened 11:03PM - 22 Aug 24 UTC
chillout23
needs-triage bug

### What is the issue? I have set up Tailscale on Raspberry Pi 5. It runs well …but I am concerned about this in my log: ` health(warnable=dns-forward-failing): error: Tailscale can't reach the configured DNS servers. Internet connectivity may be affec>` Anyone else seen this and know how to fix it? Is it a bug or is it on my side? I'm running everything with defaults. ### Steps to reproduce _No response_ ### Are there any recent changes that introduced the issue? _No response_ ### OS _No response_ ### OS version _No response_ ### Tailscale version _No response_ ### Other software _No response_ ### Bug report _No response_

The interim solution posted at the bottom of the Issue ended up working for my configuration;

sudo systemctl restart tailscaled.service && sudo tailscale up

Until this issue gets resolved in Tailscale this might be a handy command to keep around…

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 14 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
